item.description: Markdown # Citation with author > Test-driven development (TDD) is a software development process that relies on the repetition of a very short development cycle: requirements are turned into very specific test cases, then the software is improved to pass the new tests, only. > > --- [Test-driven development. (2016, November 20). In Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Retrieved 23:45, November 20, 2016](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Test-driven_development&oldid=750634597) Details/Summary collapse/expandable block <details open> <summary>Shopping list</summary> * Vegetables * Fruits * Fish </details>
